üìö CLASE EN VIVO Evaluaci√≥n NIVEL A1 - Choco Ingl√©s
Notas Generales
Objetivo

Lograr que los estudiantes pasen con √©xito todas las habilidades y demuestren que tienen los conocimientos necesarios que se requieren para ser certificados como un hablante de ingl√©s en nivel A1

¬øHasta d√≥nde se evalua en esta prueba?

Esta semana se estudia desde el m√≥dulo Choco Turbo hasta el m√≥dulo Semana 11: A1 TESTS PARA APROBAR EL NIVEL A1

Notas profesor

Este es el formato que el docente debe llenar https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1M6ymm7p4ZyLHwivDCiutwZ9XufRZbJIzYYVEzYUS3Yw/edit?gid=0#gid=0

Saludos

Los saludos deben ser reales. Un estudiante dice un saludo a otro compa√±ero y este debe darle una respuesta.

Saludos B√°sicos

Palabra

Traducci√≥n

Frase Ejemplo

Traducci√≥n Frase Ejemplo

Hi

Hola

Hi! How are you?

¬°Hola! ¬øC√≥mo est√°s?

Hello

Hola

Hello, nice to meet you!

¬°Hola, un placer conocerte!

Good morning

Buenos d√≠as

Good morning, everyone!

¬°Buenos d√≠as a todos!

Good afternoon

Buenas tardes

Good afternoon, sir.

Buenas tardes, se√±or.

Good evening

Buenas noches

Good evening, how was your day?

Buenas noches, ¬øc√≥mo estuvo tu d√≠a?

Hey

Hola (informal)

Hey, what‚Äôs up?

¬°Hola! ¬øQu√© pasa?

What‚Äôs up?

¬øQu√© tal?

What‚Äôs up, buddy?

¬øQu√© tal, amigo?

How are you?

¬øC√≥mo est√°s?

How are you today?

¬øC√≥mo est√°s hoy?

How‚Äôs it going?

¬øC√≥mo va todo?

How‚Äôs it going at work?

¬øC√≥mo va todo en el trabajo?

How do you do?

¬øC√≥mo est√° usted?

How do you do, Mr. Smith?

¬øC√≥mo est√°, Sr. Smith?
Saludos Intermedios

How have you been?

¬øC√≥mo has estado?

How have you been lately?

¬øC√≥mo has estado √∫ltimamente?

Long time no see

¬°Cu√°nto tiempo!

Long time no see, my friend!

¬°Cu√°nto tiempo, amigo!

Nice to see you

Gusto en verte

Nice to see you again!

¬°Gusto en verte de nuevo!

It‚Äôs been a while

Ha pasado tiempo

It‚Äôs been a while since we met.

Ha pasado tiempo desde que nos vimos.

How‚Äôs everything?

¬øC√≥mo va todo?

How‚Äôs everything at home?

¬øC√≥mo va todo en casa?

How‚Äôs your day?

¬øC√≥mo ha sido tu d√≠a?

How‚Äôs your day so far?

¬øC√≥mo ha sido tu d√≠a hasta ahora?

What‚Äôs new?

¬øQu√© hay de nuevo?

What‚Äôs new with you?

¬øQu√© hay de nuevo contigo?

How‚Äôs life?

¬øC√≥mo va la vida?

How‚Äôs life treating you?

¬øC√≥mo te trata la vida?

How‚Äôs work?

¬øC√≥mo va el trabajo?

How‚Äôs work these days?

¬øC√≥mo va el trabajo estos d√≠as?

How‚Äôs your family?

¬øC√≥mo est√° tu familia?

How‚Äôs your family doing?

¬øC√≥mo est√° tu familia?
Saludos Avanzados

Greetings

Saludos

Greetings, colleagues!

¬°Saludos, colegas!

Pleasure to meet you

Un placer conocerte

Pleasure to meet you in person!

¬°Un placer conocerte en persona!

What have you been up to?

¬øEn qu√© has estado?

What have you been up to lately?

¬øEn qu√© has estado √∫ltimamente?

How‚Äôs your week going?

¬øC√≥mo va tu semana?

How‚Äôs your week going so far?

¬øC√≥mo va tu semana hasta ahora?

It‚Äôs a pleasure to see you again

Es un placer verte de nuevo

It‚Äôs a pleasure to see you again after so long.

Es un placer verte de nuevo despu√©s de tanto tiempo.
A1 Evaluaci√≥n Vocabulario
Capacidad: ¬øQu√© va a hacer el profesor?
  1. Muestra una lectura al estudiante y est√© debe traducir lo que dice ese texto. Obs: Si el estudiante no puede interpretar lo que est√° leyendo, debe decir el significado de las palabras. Las palabras en negrita dentro de los textos indican palabras claves que tuvieron un refuerzo especial en la plataforma
  2. Tambi√©n debe hacer la prueba del ANKI: Cada estudiante abre su ANKI y va diciendo el significado de cada una de las tarjetas. Debe hacer un m√≠nimo de 10 tarjetas en 1 minutos
Evaluaci√≥n: ¬øQu√© debe poder hacer el estudiante?

Ser capaz de reconocer el significado de la palabra

Lecturas para evaluar el vocabulario
Evaluaci√≥n 1 Vocabulario Nivel A1

Reading Text (Students‚Äô Version):

This story is about a boy and his sister. They are playing in the yard. He has many toys and she wants to use them.
"Can I play with this car?" she said.
"You can take one, but not all," he replied.

Their dad was at home when he saw them. "What are you doing?" he asked.
"We are playing," they said.
He smiled and gave them a snack.
"This is for you. You have been good," he said.

Later, they read a book about animals. Each animal is different. Some are big, some are small.
"How do animals live?" she asked.
"It depends on where they live," he replied.
There is a bear in the forest and a fish in the sea.

If you want to know more, read books.
Books can help you learn so much.
These books are not boring, but fun.
Other kids had fun with them, too.
They said, "Reading is fun!"

Which book will you choose next?
Will it be about dogs or cats?
By reading, you learn from stories.
An idea grows up from each page.
As you grow, you learn more.

Do your best, and read all you can!

Reading Text (Teacher‚Äôs Version):

This (1) story is (2) about a (3) boy and his (4) sister. They are (5) playing in (6) the yard. He (7) has many (8) toys and (9) she wants to use (10) them (11).
"Can (12) I play with this (13) car?" she said (14).
"You can (15) take one (16), but (17) not all (18)," he (19) replied.

Their (20) dad was at (21) home when (22) he saw them. "What (23) are (24) you doing?" he asked.
"We (25) are playing," they said.
He smiled and gave them (26) a snack.
"This (27) is for (28) you. You have (29) been good," he said.

Later, they read a book about (30) animals.
Each (31) animal is (32) different. Some are (33) big, some are small.
"How (34) do animals live?" she asked.
"It (35) depends on (36) where they live," he replied.
There (37) is a bear in (38) the forest and a fish in (39) the sea.

If (40) you want to know more, read books.
Books can (41) help you learn so (42) much.
These (43) books are not (44) boring, but fun.
Other (45) kids had (46) fun with them, too.
They said (47), "Reading is fun!"

Which (48) book will you choose next?
Will (49) it be (50) about dogs or (51) cats?
By (52) reading, you learn from (53) stories.
An (54) idea grows up (55) from each page.
As (56) you grow, you learn more.

Do (57) your best, and read all (58) you can!

Evaluaci√≥n 2 Vocabulario Nivel A1

Reading Text (Students‚Äô Version): 2

One day, a girl saw some birds in her yard. She would make a picture because she like birds. She gave it to him.

She went into the house. ‚ÄúIt is time to draw,‚Äù she said. She has pencils and paper.
‚ÄúLook! I will draw two birds this time.‚Äù

She wanted to know more, so she began to write.
‚ÄúI want to go to the park to see more birds,‚Äù she said.
‚ÄúThere are a number of birds there,‚Äù Dad said.

‚ÄúBut we have no way to go now.‚Äù
‚ÄúWe could ask the people next door,‚Äù he said.

‚ÄúMy friend has a bike,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúI can go with him.‚Äù
‚ÄúIt is better than walking,‚Äù Dad said.
‚ÄúIt is the first time for this.‚Äù

She took her water bottle and bag. She had been ready all week.
‚ÄúLet‚Äôs call Amy and ask who wants to go.‚Äù

At the park, she saw a bird with oil on its wings.
‚ÄúNow I can find many birds!‚Äù she said.

They walked a long way and sat down under a tree.
They stayed all day. She did many pictures.

‚ÄúYou get better!‚Äù Dad said.
More kids come to see what she made.
‚ÄúYou may help others learn,‚Äù said a boy.

This part was the best part of her week.
There were birds flying over the trees.
The birds made a new sound.

‚ÄúLet‚Äôs take a photo!‚Äù Dad said.
‚ÄúOnly a little wind today,‚Äù she said.
‚ÄúIt was work, but it was fun.‚Äù
‚ÄúI know this place is very nice,‚Äù she said.

Reading Text (Teacher‚Äôs Version): 2

One day (1), a girl saw some (2) birds in her (3) yard. She would (4) make (5) a picture because she like (6) birds. She gave it to him (7).

She went into (8) the house. ‚ÄúIt is time (9) to draw,‚Äù she said. She has (10) pencils and paper.
‚ÄúLook (11)! I will draw two (12) birds this time.‚Äù

She wanted to know more (13), so she began to write (14).
‚ÄúI want to go (15) to the park to see (16) more birds,‚Äù she said.
‚ÄúThere are a number (17) of birds there,‚Äù Dad said.

‚ÄúBut we have no (18) way (19) to go now.‚Äù
‚ÄúWe could (20) ask the people (21) next door,‚Äù he said.

‚ÄúMy (22) friend has a bike,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúI can go with him.‚Äù
‚ÄúIt is better than (23) walking,‚Äù Dad said.
‚ÄúIt is the first (24) time for this.‚Äù

She took her water (25) bottle and bag. She had been (26) ready all week.
‚ÄúLet‚Äôs call (27) Amy and ask who (28) wants to go.‚Äù

At the park, she saw a bird with oil (29) on its (30) wings.
‚ÄúNow (31) I can find (32) many birds!‚Äù she said.

They walked a long (33) way and sat down (34) under a tree.
They stayed all day (35). She did (36) many pictures.

‚ÄúYou get (37) better!‚Äù Dad said.
More kids come (38) to see what she made (39).
‚ÄúYou may (40) help others learn,‚Äù said a boy.

This part was the best part (41) of her week.
There were birds flying over (42) the trees.
The birds made a new (43) sound (44).

‚ÄúLet‚Äôs take (45) a photo!‚Äù Dad said.
‚ÄúOnly (46) a little (47) wind today,‚Äù she said.
‚ÄúIt was work (48), but it was fun.‚Äù
‚ÄúI know (49) this place (50) is very (51) nice,‚Äù she said.

Evaluaci√≥n 3 Vocabulario Nivel A1

Reading Text (Students‚Äô Version): 3

One day, after lunch, we went back to class.
The teacher said, ‚ÄúI have a good story for you. Look at me and listen.‚Äù

She said, ‚ÄúThis is our book. I will read just one page. The boy‚Äôs name is Tom.‚Äù
She read the sentence: ‚ÄúThe man is kind.‚Äù

I think it is fun when teachers say stories.
‚ÄúIt is a great story,‚Äù said Sam.
‚ÄúWhere did you get it?‚Äù he asked.

‚ÄúIt can help us read better,‚Äù she said.
We read through the book. It was so much fun.

We had to finish before we go home.
‚ÄúMake a line,‚Äù the teacher said.
‚ÄúGo to the right, not the left.‚Äù

‚ÄúI want to read too,‚Äù said Anna.
She asked, ‚ÄúWhat means this word?‚Äù

My dad is old, but he reads to me.
He said, ‚ÄúIf you find any hard words, ask.‚Äù

We all had the same book.
I will tell my mom about it.
The boy in the story can run fast.

I like to follow the words with my finger.
The teacher came to help me.
I want to read more books now.

We had to show the page to a friend.
‚ÄúI will also draw the boy,‚Äù said Kim.
We looked around the room. Everyone smiled.

Let‚Äôs form a team to read.
We picked three kids. I was happy.

‚ÄúI see one small cat in the book,‚Äù said Max.
The teacher said, ‚ÄúNow we will set the book on the shelf.‚Äù

We put it there and went to the door.
‚ÄúIt is the end of class,‚Äù she said.

‚ÄúDoes everyone have the paper?‚Äù
We took another one, well made.

The cat was not large, not big, but it was cute.
We must read that page again!

‚ÄúTom is nice. He can even help the cat.‚Äù
‚ÄúIt is such a sweet story,‚Äù I said.

We clapped, because we loved it.
‚ÄúNow, we will turn the lights off,‚Äù the teacher said.

‚ÄúHere is your bag,‚Äù she told me.
‚ÄúWhy do you smile so much?‚Äù she asked.

Reading Text (Teacher‚Äôs Version): 3

One day, after (1) lunch, we went back (2) to class.
The teacher said, ‚ÄúI have a good (3) story for you. Look at me (4) and listen.‚Äù

She said, ‚ÄúThis is our (5) book. I will read just (6) one page. The boy‚Äôs name (7) is Tom.‚Äù
She read the sentence (8): ‚ÄúThe man (9) is kind.‚Äù

I think (10) it is fun when teachers say (11) stories.
‚ÄúIt is a great (12) story,‚Äù said Sam.
‚ÄúWhere (13) did you get it?‚Äù he asked.

‚ÄúIt can help (14) us read better,‚Äù she said.
We read through (15) the book. It was so much (16) fun.

We had to finish before (17) we go home.
‚ÄúMake a line (18),‚Äù the teacher said.
‚ÄúGo to the right (19), not the left.‚Äù

‚ÄúI want to read too (20),‚Äù said Anna.
She asked, ‚ÄúWhat means (21) this word?‚Äù

My dad is old (22), but he reads to me.
He said, ‚ÄúIf you find any (23) hard words, ask.‚Äù

We all had the same (24) book.
I will tell (25) my mom about it.
The boy (26) in the story can run fast.

I like to follow (27) the words with my finger.
The teacher came (28) to help me.
I want (29) to read more books now.

We had to show (30) the page to a friend.
‚ÄúI will also (31) draw the boy,‚Äù said Kim.
We looked around (32) the room. Everyone smiled.

Let‚Äôs form (33) a team to read.
We picked three (34) kids. I was happy.

‚ÄúI see one small (35) cat in the book,‚Äù said Max.
The teacher said, ‚ÄúNow we will set (36) the book on the shelf.‚Äù

We put (37) it there and went to the door.
‚ÄúIt is the end (38) of class,‚Äù she said.

‚ÄúDoes (39) everyone have the paper?‚Äù
We took another (40) one, well (41) made.

The cat was not large (42), not big (43), but it was cute.
We must (44) read that page again!

‚ÄúTom is nice. He can even (45) help the cat.‚Äù
‚ÄúIt is such (46) a sweet story,‚Äù I said.

We clapped, because (47) we loved it.
‚ÄúNow, we will turn (48) the lights off,‚Äù the teacher said.

‚ÄúHere (49) is your bag,‚Äù she told me.
‚ÄúWhy (50) do you smile so much?‚Äù she asked.

Evaluaci√≥n 4 Vocabulario Nivel A1

Reading Text (Students‚Äô Version): 4

Today, the teacher said, ‚ÄúPlease ask questions if you do not understand.‚Äù
We went to class early. The men who work at the school cleaned the floor.

We sat and read a short story.
‚ÄúYou need to listen,‚Äù the teacher said.

‚ÄúThis land has many places with different animals.‚Äù
When we go home, we tell our mom what we learned. She helps us with reading.

Next, we will move to another class.
‚ÄúI will try to do my best,‚Äù I said.

The teacher is very kind.
She gave me a high-five with her hand.
We looked at a big picture of a tree.
Then we looked at it again.

We had to change our seats.
Then the lights went off.

We wanted to play a game with words.
‚ÄúSpell this word: air,‚Äù the teacher said.
We talked about the air and how we breathe it.

The cat ran away from the door.
It is a nice animal.
In my house, I have two pets.

The teacher pointed to the board and said, ‚ÄúPoint to the word ‚Äòtree‚Äô on the page.‚Äù
We also looked at the first letter of each word.

My mother helps me learn at home.
She helps me answer the questions.

Today I found a new book.
I want to study it more.

We are still in class.
I like to learn new things.

We should be ready to go outside.
We talked about America and what makes it special.

The world is big. We want to learn more.
The sun is high in the sky today.

Every kid has a book.
We sit near each other and talk.

Let‚Äôs add color to the map.
We talked about our favorite food.

The teacher stood between two desks.
This is our own book, not shared.

We looked below the desk and found a pencil.
We talked about a country with many plants.

I like to plant seeds in the garden.
This is the last week of school.

We love our school.
My father says I must go and learn.

I want to keep my books safe and clean.

Reading Text (Teacher‚Äôs Version): 4

Today, the teacher said, ‚ÄúPlease ask (1) questions if you do not understand.‚Äù
We went (2) to class early. The men (3) who work at the school cleaned the floor.

We sat and read (4) a short story.
‚ÄúYou need (5) to listen,‚Äù the teacher said.

‚ÄúThis land (6) has many places with different (7) animals.‚Äù
When we go home (8), we tell our mom what we learned. She helps us (9) with reading.

Next, we will move (10) to another class.
‚ÄúI will try (11) to do my best,‚Äù I said.

The teacher is very kind (12).
She gave me a high-five with her hand (13).
We looked at a big picture (14) of a tree.
Then we looked at it again (15).

We had to change (16) our seats.
Then the lights went off (17).

We wanted to play (18) a game with words.
‚ÄúSpell (19) this word: air,‚Äù the teacher said.
We talked about the air (20) and how we breathe it.

The cat ran away (21) from the door.
It is a nice animal (22).
In my house (23), I have two pets.

The teacher pointed to the board and said, ‚ÄúPoint (24) to the word ‚Äòtree‚Äô on the page (25).‚Äù
We also looked at the first letter (26) of each word.

My mother (27) helps me learn at home.
She helps me answer (28) the questions.

Today I found (29) a new book.
I want to study (30) it more.

We are still (31) in class.
I like to learn (32) new things.

We should (33) be ready to go outside.
We talked about America (34) and what makes it special.

The world (35) is big. We want to learn more.
The sun is high (36) in the sky today.

Every (37) kid has a book.
We sit near (38) each other and talk.

Let‚Äôs add (39) color to the map.
We talked about our favorite food (40).

The teacher stood between (41) two desks.
This is our own (42) book, not shared.

We looked below (43) the desk and found a pencil.

A1 Evaluaci√≥n Temas
Capacidad: ¬øQu√© va a hacer el profesor? 2

Hace las preguntas para evaluar los temas que debe conocer en ese nivel como familia, info personal; aunque reconocemos que no se ha abarcado completamente.

Evaluaci√≥n: ¬øQu√© debe poder hacer el estudiante? 2

Ser capaz de responder las preguntas con una respuesta en nivel b√°sico

Preguntas para evaluar los temas
Tema 1: 1. Personal Information & Identity

  1. What‚Äôs your name?

  2. Where are you from?

  3. How old are you?

  4. Do you have brothers or sisters?

  5. What‚Äôs your mother's name?

  6. What‚Äôs your father's job?

  7. Do you have a big family?

  8. Are you married?

  9. Do you have children?

  10. What are your children‚Äôs names?

  11. What time do you wake up?

  12. What do you usually eat for breakfast?

  13. Do you like coffee or tea?

  14. What time do you go to bed?

  15. Can you cook?

  16. What do you do on weekends?

  17. What‚Äôs your favorite food?

  18. Do you speak English?

  19. What other languages do you speak?

  20. What‚Äôs your favorite color?

  21. What do you do? (What's your job?)

  22. Where do you live?

  23. Do you live in a house or an apartment?

  24. What‚Äôs your address?

  25. What‚Äôs your phone number?

  26. What‚Äôs your email address?

  27. What‚Äôs the weather like today?

  28. What day is it today?

  29. What time is it now?

  30. What‚Äôs your favorite day of the week?

  31. What do you do in the morning?

  32. What do you do in the evening?

  33. Do you have any pets?

  34. What‚Äôs your favorite animal?

  35. What‚Äôs your favorite sport?

  36. Can you play the guitar?

  37. What music do you like?

  38. What‚Äôs your favorite movie?

  39. What do you do in your free time?

  40. What time do you start work?

  41. What time do you finish work?

  42. Do you like traveling?

  43. Have you ever been to another country?

  44. Do you like learning English?

  45. What‚Äôs your favorite English word?

  46. What clothes are you wearing now?

  47. What do you usually wear to work?

  48. What‚Äôs your best friend‚Äôs name?

  49. Where does your best friend live?

  50. Tell me about your family.

Tema 2: 2. Family

  1. Who is your mom?

  2. What‚Äôs your dad‚Äôs name?

  3. Do you have a brother?

  4. How many sisters do you have?

  5. Is your grandma alive?

  6. Where does your grandpa live?

  7. Is your baby brother funny?

  8. How old is your child?

  9. What does your mom do?

  10. Does your dad like music?

  11. Do you live with your parents?

  12. How many children do you have?

  13. Is your husband at home now?

  14. What‚Äôs your wife‚Äôs name?

  15. Do you have a son or a daughter?

  16. Do your cousins live near you?

  17. Does your uncle visit often?

  18. What does your aunt like to cook?

  19. How many siblings do you have?

  20. Does your cousin have a pet?

  21. Do you have any grandchildren?

  22. What‚Äôs your nephew‚Äôs name?

  23. Is your niece still a child?

  24. Do you like your stepmom?

  25. Where does your stepdad work?

  26. Do you have a stepson or a stepdaughter?

  27. Is your partner friendly?

  28. Are you engaged?

  29. Was your grandpa a teacher?

  30. Who is your mother-in-law?

  31. Are you a twin?

  32. Do you have any adopted siblings?

  33. Who is the tallest in your family?

  34. Is your sister older than you?

  35. Are your parents kind?

  36. Do you live in a big household?

  37. Is your mom strict or relaxed?

  38. Who is the youngest in your family?

  39. Do you know your ancestors?

  40. How many people live in your house?

  41. Do you have a stepbrother?

  42. How old is your stepsister?

  43. Do you visit your great-grandparents?

  44. Do you have a half-brother or half-sister?

  45. Is your family close or distant?

  46. Who is the oldest person in your family?

  47. Do you know your family‚Äôs lineage?

  48. Who is the matriarch in your family?

  49. Are you close to your kin?

  50. Will you visit your family next weekend?

Tema 3: 3. Daily Routines ‚è∞ü™•üçΩÔ∏è

  1. What time do you get up?

  2. Do you brush your teeth every morning?

  3. What do you do after breakfast?

  4. What time do you go to school or work?

  5. Do you take a shower in the morning or at night?

  6. What do you eat for breakfast?

  7. What time do you have lunch?

  8. Do you go to bed early or late?

  9. What do you do in the afternoon?

  10. Do you make your bed every day?

  11. What time do you finish work or school?

  12. Do you cook dinner?

  13. Do you watch TV in the evening?

  14. What time do you go to sleep?

  15. Do you use your phone before sleeping?

  16. Do you clean your room every day?

  17. What do you do on weekends?

  18. Do you drink coffee or tea in the morning?

  19. What time do you leave your house?

  20. Do you walk or take a bus to school/work?

  21. Do you study at night?

  22. What do you do before you sleep?

  23. Do you listen to music during the day?

  24. What time do you eat dinner?

  25. Do you do the same things every day?

A1 Evaluaci√≥n Listening
Capacidad: ¬øQu√© va a hacer el profesor? 3
  1. Opci√≥n 1: El profesor coloca un audio de reductores de ruido y el estudiante dice qu√© dijo el audio y lo traduce al espa√±ol. (El estudiante dice: She‚Äôs tall - Ella es alta)

Evaluaci√≥n: ¬øQu√© debe poder hacer el estudiante? 3

Debe poder entender los siguientes audios.

Audios a evaluar

A1 Evaluaci√≥n Comprensi√≥n
Capacidad: ¬øQu√© va a hacer el profesor? 4

Va a evaluar las estructuras que debe manejar en ese nivel como tiempos y verbos.

Evaluaci√≥n: ¬øQu√© debe poder hacer el estudiante? 4

Debe poder comprender cualquiera de las siguientes lecturas

Lecturas a Evaluar
Lectura 1 Comprensi√≥n Nivel A1

1. My Family

I have a small family. I live with my parents and my brother. My mother is a teacher, and my father is a doctor. My brother is 10 years old. He likes to play soccer. We have a dog. Its name is Max. We love Max very much.

2. My House

I live in a big house. There are three bedrooms, a kitchen, a living room, and two bathrooms. My bedroom is small, but I like it. There is a bed, a desk, and a chair in my room. I also have a window with a nice view.

3. My Best Friend

My best friend is Maria. She is 20 years old. She lives in my neighborhood. We like to study and play together. Maria is very funny and kind. She likes to draw and listen to music. I like her because she always helps me.

Lectura 2 Comprensi√≥n Nivel A1

4. My Favorite Food

I love pizza! My favorite pizza has cheese, tomatoes, and chicken. I also like pasta and rice. For dessert, I like ice cream and chocolate. On weekends, my family eats dinner at a restaurant. We always enjoy the food!

5. A Day at School

I go to school from Monday to Friday. My classes start at 8:00 a.m. and finish at 3:00 p.m. My favorite subject is English. I also like math, but it is a little difficult. At school, I talk with my friends and play in the park during lunch.

6. My Hobbies

I have many hobbies. I like to play basketball and swim. I also like to read books and watch movies. On Saturdays, I go to the park to ride my bike. I enjoy drawing pictures, too. Hobbies make me happy.

7. The Weather

Today, the weather is sunny and warm. I like sunny days because I can go outside. In the summer, it is very hot, but I enjoy swimming. In the winter, it is cold and sometimes snowy. I wear a coat, scarf, and gloves in winter.

Lectura 3 Comprensi√≥n Nivel A1

Dayana: I need your help, can you help me please?
Richard: Sure, tell me what you need

Dayana: What time is it?
Richard: It's 8 o'clock

Dayana: What's your phone number?
Richard: It's 3103534870

Dayana: What's your email address?
Richard: It's chocoenglish@gmail.com

Dayana: How do you say ‚Äúarroz‚Äù?
Richard: Rice

Dayana: Are you married?
Richard: Yes, I'm married

Lectura 4 Comprensi√≥n Nivel A1

Dayana: How was your day?
Richard: It was great, I really enjoyed it

Dayana: How was your weekend?
Richard: It was really bad, I couldn't do much

Dayana: Who‚Äôs your best friend?
Richard: My best friend is my cousin, Marta

Dayana: Do you have siblings?
Richard: Yeah, I have siblings

Dayana: How many siblings do you have?
Richard: Yeah, I have 6 siblings: 1 sister and 5 brothers

Dayana: Do you have children?
Richard: Yeah, I have children

Dayana: How many children do you have?
Richard: I've got 4 kids: 1 boy and 3 girls

Dayana: Do you have friends?
Richard: Yeah, I've got friends

Dayana: How many friends do you have?
Richard: Wow, I've got a lot of friends

A1 Evaluaci√≥n Speaking
Capacidad: ¬øQu√© va a hacer el profesor? 5

Hace las preguntas para evaluar su capacidad de comunicarse y hablar en ingl√©s

Evaluaci√≥n: ¬øQu√© debe poder hacer el estudiante? 5

Ser capaz de responder las preguntas con una respuesta en nivel b√°sico

Preguntas para evaluar el speaking
  1. How are you?
  2. What's your name?
  3. Where are you from?
  4. How old are you?
  5. When‚Äôs your birthday?
  6. Where do you live?
  7. What do you do?
  8. Where do you work/study?
  9. What's your favorite [book/movie/food/hobby/color]?
  10. What time is it?
  11. I need your help, can you help me please?
  12. What do you think about money/politics‚Ä¶?
  13. What will you do tomorrow?
  14. Do you have any plans for the weekend?

  18. How was your day/weekend?
  19. Who‚Äôs your best friend?
  20. Do you have siblings/children/friends? How many?
  21. How do you say ‚Äúarroz‚Äù?
  22. Are you married/single/engaged?
  23. I would like to know a little bit about you
  24. What would you do if‚Ä¶
  25. Would you like a sandwich?
  26. Would you like some water?
  27. Would you like to go to the park?
  28. Would you like to meet my friend?
  29. Would you like to watch a movie?
  30. Is it cold?
  31. Is it sunny today?
  32. What‚Äôs the weather like?

  35. What do you have the menu?
  36. Do you like pizza?
  37. Can you say "sorry"?
  38. How do you say "thank you"?
  39. Can you repeat, please?
  40. Can you open the door?
  41. Where is the bathroom?
  42. How do I go to the park?
A1 Evaluaci√≥n Herramientas
Capacidad: ¬øQu√© va a hacer el profesor? 6
  • Asegurarse de que todos los estudiantes tienen las actividades de este nivel realizadas para poder ser aprobados en esta evaluaci√≥n.
  • El profesor hace una evaluaci√≥n del ANKI de cada estudiante tal y como se hace en las clases en vivo regulares; la diferencia radica en que el profesor eval√∫a (sin previo aviso) diferentes contenidos al mismo estudiante en la misma clase
Actividades a realizar
  1. Audios Diarios: 60 publicaciones subidas
  2. Actividades de la plataforma: 25 publicaciones subidas
  3. Tests: 9 tests aprobados subidas
Evaluaci√≥n: ¬øQu√© debe poder hacer el estudiante? 6
  • Plataforma y herramientas: Conocer todo el contenido del ANKI.
  • Herramienta de reducci√≥n de ruido: Que pueda entender cualquier audio de reducci√≥n de ruido
Reducci√≥n de Ruido a Evaluar (Las mismas del nivel)

Bye! See you soon!

¬°Adi√≥s! ¬°Nos vemos pronto!

Goodbye

Adi√≥s (formal)

Goodbye, take care!

Adi√≥s, ¬°cu√≠date!

See you later

Nos vemos luego

See you later, alligator!

¬°Nos vemos luego, cocodrilo!

Nos vemos pronto

See you soon, my friend!

¬°Nos vemos pronto, amigo!

Cu√≠date

Take care and stay safe!

¬°Cu√≠date y mantente a salvo!

Nos vemos ma√±ana

See you tomorrow at school!

¬°Nos vemos ma√±ana en la escuela!

See you next time

Nos vemos la pr√≥xima

See you next time, John!

¬°Nos vemos la pr√≥xima, John!

Have a good day

Que tengas un buen d√≠a

Have a good day at work!

¬°Que tengas un buen d√≠a en el trabajo!

Have a nice day

Que tengas un lindo d√≠a

¬°Que tengan un lindo d√≠a, todos!

Have a great day

Que tengas un gran d√≠a

¬°Que tengas un gran d√≠a por delante!
Despedidas Intermedios 2

Take it easy

T√≥malo con calma

Take it easy, don‚Äôt stress!

T√≥malo con calma, ¬°no te estreses!

Te veo luego

¬°Te veo luego, amigo!

Me tengo que ir, ¬°hablamos luego!

Hablamos luego, ¬øok?

Hasta la pr√≥xima

¬°Hasta la pr√≥xima, amigo!

Que te vaya bien

¬°Que te vaya bien, cu√≠date!

Me largo (informal)

¬°Me largo, chicos!

Later, dude!

¬°Nos vemos, amigo!

Hasta que nos veamos de nuevo, amigo!

Mantente a salvo

¬°Mantente a salvo en tu viaje!
Despedidas Avanzados 2

Fue un gusto verte

Fue un gusto verte de nuevo.

Cu√≠date bien

Take care of yourself, okay?

Cu√≠date bien, ¬øvale?

¬°Mantente en contacto, no me olvides!

Te deseo lo mejor

¬°Te deseo lo mejor en tu nuevo trabajo!
Notas Generales
Objetivo

Lograr que los estudiantes pasen con √©xito todas las habilidades y demuestren que tienen los conocimientos necesarios que se requieren para ser certificados como un hablante de ingl√©s en nivel A1

¬øHasta d√≥nde se evalua en esta prueba?

Esta semana se estudia desde el m√≥dulo Choco Turbo hasta el m√≥dulo Semana 11: A1 TESTS PARA APROBAR EL NIVEL A1

Notas profesor

Este es el formato que el docente debe llenar https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1M6ymm7p4ZyLHwivDCiutwZ9XufRZbJIzYYVEzYUS3Yw/edit?gid=0#gid=0

Saludos

Los saludos deben ser reales. Un estudiante dice un saludo a otro compa√±ero y este debe darle una respuesta.

Saludos B√°sicos

Palabra

Traducci√≥n

Frase Ejemplo

Traducci√≥n Frase Ejemplo

Hi

Hola

Hi! How are you?

¬°Hola! ¬øC√≥mo est√°s?

Hello, nice to meet you!

¬°Hola, un placer conocerte!

Buenos d√≠as

Good morning, everyone!

¬°Buenos d√≠as a todos!

Buenas tardes

Good afternoon, sir.

Buenas tardes, se√±or.

Good evening

Buenas noches

Good evening, how was your day?

Buenas noches, ¬øc√≥mo estuvo tu d√≠a?

Hey

Hola (informal)

Hey, what‚Äôs up?

¬°Hola! ¬øQu√© pasa?

¬øQu√© tal?

What‚Äôs up, buddy?

¬øQu√© tal, amigo?

¬øC√≥mo est√°s hoy?

¬øC√≥mo est√° usted?

¬øC√≥mo est√°, Sr. Smith?

¬°Cu√°nto tiempo, amigo!

A1 Evaluaci√≥n Vocabulario
Capacidad: ¬øQu√© va a hacer el profesor?
  1. Muestra una lectura al estudiante y est√© debe traducir lo que dice ese texto. Obs: Si el estudiante no puede interpretar lo que est√° leyendo, debe decir el significado de las palabras. Las palabras en negrita dentro de los textos indican palabras claves que tuvieron un refuerzo especial en la plataforma
  2. Tambi√©n debe hacer la prueba del ANKI: Cada estudiante abre su ANKI y va diciendo el significado de cada una de las tarjetas. Debe hacer un m√≠nimo de 10 tarjetas en 1 minutos
Evaluaci√≥n: ¬øQu√© debe poder hacer el estudiante?

Ser capaz de reconocer el significado de la palabra

Lecturas para evaluar el vocabulario
Evaluaci√≥n 1 Vocabulario Nivel A1

Reading Text (Students‚Äô Version):

This story is about a boy and his sister. They are playing in the yard. He has many toys and she wants to use them.
"Can I play with this car?" she said.
"You can take one, but not all," he replied.

Their dad was at home when he saw them. "What are you doing?" he asked.
"We are playing," they said.
He smiled and gave them a snack.
"This is for you. You have been good," he said.

Later, they read a book about animals. Each animal is different. Some are big, some are small.
"How do animals live?" she asked.
"It depends on where they live," he replied.
There is a bear in the forest and a fish in the sea.

If you want to know more, read books.
Books can help you learn so much.
These books are not boring, but fun.
Other kids had fun with them, too.
They said, "Reading is fun!"

Which book will you choose next?
Will it be about dogs or cats?
By reading, you learn from stories.
An idea grows up from each page.
As you grow, you learn more.

Do your best, and read all you can!

Reading Text (Teacher‚Äôs Version):

This (1) story is (2) about a (3) boy and his (4) sister. They are (5) playing in (6) the yard. He (7) has many (8) toys and (9) she wants to use (10) them (11).
"Can (12) I play with this (13) car?" she said (14).
"You can (15) take one (16), but (17) not all (18)," he (19) replied.

Their (20) dad was at (21) home when (22) he saw them. "What (23) are (24) you doing?" he asked.
"We (25) are playing," they said.
He smiled and gave them (26) a snack.
"This (27) is for (28) you. You have (29) been good," he said.

Later, they read a book about (30) animals.
Each (31) animal is (32) different. Some are (33) big, some are small.
"How (34) do animals live?" she asked.
"It (35) depends on (36) where they live," he replied.
There (37) is a bear in (38) the forest and a fish in (39) the sea.

If (40) you want to know more, read books.
Books can (41) help you learn so (42) much.
These (43) books are not (44) boring, but fun.
Other (45) kids had (46) fun with them, too.
They said (47), "Reading is fun!"

Which (48) book will you choose next?
Will (49) it be (50) about dogs or (51) cats?
By (52) reading, you learn from (53) stories.
An (54) idea grows up (55) from each page.
As (56) you grow, you learn more.

Do (57) your best, and read all (58) you can!

Evaluaci√≥n 2 Vocabulario Nivel A1

Reading Text (Students‚Äô Version): 2

One day, a girl saw some birds in her yard. She would make a picture because she like birds. She gave it to him.

She went into the house. ‚ÄúIt is time to draw,‚Äù she said. She has pencils and paper.
‚ÄúLook! I will draw two birds this time.‚Äù

She wanted to know more, so she began to write.
‚ÄúI want to go to the park to see more birds,‚Äù she said.
‚ÄúThere are a number of birds there,‚Äù Dad said.

‚ÄúBut we have no way to go now.‚Äù
‚ÄúWe could ask the people next door,‚Äù he said.

‚ÄúMy friend has a bike,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúI can go with him.‚Äù
‚ÄúIt is better than walking,‚Äù Dad said.
‚ÄúIt is the first time for this.‚Äù

She took her water bottle and bag. She had been ready all week.
‚ÄúLet‚Äôs call Amy and ask who wants to go.‚Äù

At the park, she saw a bird with oil on its wings.
‚ÄúNow I can find many birds!‚Äù she said.

They walked a long way and sat down under a tree.
They stayed all day. She did many pictures.

‚ÄúYou get better!‚Äù Dad said.
More kids come to see what she made.
‚ÄúYou may help others learn,‚Äù said a boy.

This part was the best part of her week.
There were birds flying over the trees.
The birds made a new sound.

‚ÄúLet‚Äôs take a photo!‚Äù Dad said.
‚ÄúOnly a little wind today,‚Äù she said.
‚ÄúIt was work, but it was fun.‚Äù
‚ÄúI know this place is very nice,‚Äù she said.

Reading Text (Teacher‚Äôs Version): 2

One day (1), a girl saw some (2) birds in her (3) yard. She would (4) make (5) a picture because she like (6) birds. She gave it to him (7).

She went into (8) the house. ‚ÄúIt is time (9) to draw,‚Äù she said. She has (10) pencils and paper.
‚ÄúLook (11)! I will draw two (12) birds this time.‚Äù

She wanted to know more (13), so she began to write (14).
‚ÄúI want to go (15) to the park to see (16) more birds,‚Äù she said.
‚ÄúThere are a number (17) of birds there,‚Äù Dad said.

‚ÄúBut we have no (18) way (19) to go now.‚Äù
‚ÄúWe could (20) ask the people (21) next door,‚Äù he said.

‚ÄúMy (22) friend has a bike,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúI can go with him.‚Äù
‚ÄúIt is better than (23) walking,‚Äù Dad said.
‚ÄúIt is the first (24) time for this.‚Äù

She took her water (25) bottle and bag. She had been (26) ready all week.
‚ÄúLet‚Äôs call (27) Amy and ask who (28) wants to go.‚Äù

At the park, she saw a bird with oil (29) on its (30) wings.
‚ÄúNow (31) I can find (32) many birds!‚Äù she said.

They walked a long (33) way and sat down (34) under a tree.
They stayed all day (35). She did (36) many pictures.

‚ÄúYou get (37) better!‚Äù Dad said.
More kids come (38) to see what she made (39).
‚ÄúYou may (40) help others learn,‚Äù said a boy.

This part was the best part (41) of her week.
There were birds flying over (42) the trees.
The birds made a new (43) sound (44).

‚ÄúLet‚Äôs take (45) a photo!‚Äù Dad said.
‚ÄúOnly (46) a little (47) wind today,‚Äù she said.
‚ÄúIt was work (48), but it was fun.‚Äù
‚ÄúI know (49) this place (50) is very (51) nice,‚Äù she said.

Evaluaci√≥n 3 Vocabulario Nivel A1

Reading Text (Students‚Äô Version): 3

One day, after lunch, we went back to class.
The teacher said, ‚ÄúI have a good story for you. Look at me and listen.‚Äù

She said, ‚ÄúThis is our book. I will read just one page. The boy‚Äôs name is Tom.‚Äù
She read the sentence: ‚ÄúThe man is kind.‚Äù

I think it is fun when teachers say stories.
‚ÄúIt is a great story,‚Äù said Sam.
‚ÄúWhere did you get it?‚Äù he asked.

‚ÄúIt can help us read better,‚Äù she said.
We read through the book. It was so much fun.

We had to finish before we go home.
‚ÄúMake a line,‚Äù the teacher said.
‚ÄúGo to the right, not the left.‚Äù

‚ÄúI want to read too,‚Äù said Anna.
She asked, ‚ÄúWhat means this word?‚Äù

My dad is old, but he reads to me.
He said, ‚ÄúIf you find any hard words, ask.‚Äù

We all had the same book.
I will tell my mom about it.
The boy in the story can run fast.

I like to follow the words with my finger.
The teacher came to help me.
I want to read more books now.

We had to show the page to a friend.
‚ÄúI will also draw the boy,‚Äù said Kim.
We looked around the room. Everyone smiled.

Let‚Äôs form a team to read.
We picked three kids. I was happy.

‚ÄúI see one small cat in the book,‚Äù said Max.
The teacher said, ‚ÄúNow we will set the book on the shelf.‚Äù

We put it there and went to the door.
‚ÄúIt is the end of class,‚Äù she said.

‚ÄúDoes everyone have the paper?‚Äù
We took another one, well made.

The cat was not large, not big, but it was cute.
We must read that page again!

‚ÄúTom is nice. He can even help the cat.‚Äù
‚ÄúIt is such a sweet story,‚Äù I said.

We clapped, because we loved it.
‚ÄúNow, we will turn the lights off,‚Äù the teacher said.

‚ÄúHere is your bag,‚Äù she told me.
‚ÄúWhy do you smile so much?‚Äù she asked.

One day, after (1) lunch, we went back (2) to class.
The teacher said, ‚ÄúI have a good (3) story for you. Look at me (4) and listen.‚Äù

She said, ‚ÄúThis is our (5) book. I will read just (6) one page. The boy‚Äôs name (7) is Tom.‚Äù
She read the sentence (8): ‚ÄúThe man (9) is kind.‚Äù

I think (10) it is fun when teachers say (11) stories.
‚ÄúIt is a great (12) story,‚Äù said Sam.
‚ÄúWhere (13) did you get it?‚Äù he asked.

‚ÄúIt can help (14) us read better,‚Äù she said.
We read through (15) the book. It was so much (16) fun.

We had to finish before (17) we go home.

‚ÄúI want to read too (20),‚Äù said Anna.

We picked three (34) kids. I was happy.

We put (37) it there and went to the door.

Evaluaci√≥n 4 Vocabulario Nivel A1

Reading Text (Students‚Äô Version): 4

Today, the teacher said, ‚ÄúPlease ask questions if you do not understand.‚Äù
We went to class early. The men who work at the school cleaned the floor.

We sat and read a short story.
‚ÄúYou need to listen,‚Äù the teacher said.

‚ÄúThis land has many places with different animals.‚Äù
When we go home, we tell our mom what we learned. She helps us with reading.

Next, we will move to another class.
‚ÄúI will try to do my best,‚Äù I said.

The teacher is very kind.
She gave me a high-five with her hand.
We looked at a big picture of a tree.
Then we looked at it again.

We had to change our seats.
Then the lights went off.

We wanted to play a game with words.
‚ÄúSpell this word: air,‚Äù the teacher said.
We talked about the air and how we breathe it.

The cat ran away from the door.
It is a nice animal.
In my house, I have two pets.

The teacher pointed to the board and said, ‚ÄúPoint to the word ‚Äòtree‚Äô on the page.‚Äù
We also looked at the first letter of each word.

My mother helps me learn at home.
She helps me answer the questions.

Today I found a new book.
I want to study it more.

We are still in class.
I like to learn new things.

We should be ready to go outside.
We talked about America and what makes it special.

The world is big. We want to learn more.
The sun is high in the sky today.

Every kid has a book.
We sit near each other and talk.

Let‚Äôs add color to the map.
We talked about our favorite food.

The teacher stood between two desks.
This is our own book, not shared.

We looked below the desk and found a pencil.
We talked about a country with many plants.

I like to plant seeds in the garden.
This is the last week of school.

We love our school.
My father says I must go and learn.

I want to keep my books safe and clean.

Reading Text (Teacher‚Äôs Version): 4

We went (2) to class early. The men (3) who work at the school cleaned the floor.

We sat and read (4) a short story.
‚ÄúYou need (5) to listen,‚Äù the teacher said.

‚ÄúThis land (6) has many places with different (7) animals.‚Äù

Next, we will move (10) to another class.
‚ÄúI will try (11) to do my best,‚Äù I said.

The teacher is very kind (12).
She gave me a high-five with her hand (13).
We looked at a big picture (14) of a tree.
Then we looked at it again (15).

We had to change (16) our seats.
Then the lights went off (17).

She helps me answer (28) the questions.

Today I found (29) a new book.

We talked about America (34) and what makes it special.

The world (35) is big. We want to learn more.
The sun is high (36) in the sky today.

We sit near (38) each other and talk.

Let‚Äôs add (39) color to the map.

Lecturas para evaluar el vocabulario
Evaluaci√≥n 1 Vocabulario Nivel A1

Reading Text (Students‚Äô Version):

This story is about a boy and his sister. They are playing in the yard. He has many toys and she wants to use them.
"Can I play with this car?" she said.
"You can take one, but not all," he replied.

Their dad was at home when he saw them. "What are you doing?" he asked.
"We are playing," they said.
He smiled and gave them a snack.
"This is for you. You have been good," he said.

Later, they read a book about animals. Each animal is different. Some are big, some are small.
"How do animals live?" she asked.
"It depends on where they live," he replied.
There is a bear in the forest and a fish in the sea.

If you want to know more, read books.
Books can help you learn so much.
These books are not boring, but fun.
Other kids had fun with them, too.
They said, "Reading is fun!"

Which book will you choose next?
Will it be about dogs or cats?
By reading, you learn from stories.
An idea grows up from each page.
As you grow, you learn more.

Do your best, and read all you can!

Reading Text (Teacher‚Äôs Version):

This (1) story is (2) about a (3) boy and his (4) sister. They are (5) playing in (6) the yard. He (7) has many (8) toys and (9) she wants to use (10) them (11).
"Can (12) I play with this (13) car?" she said (14).
"You can (15) take one (16), but (17) not all (18)," he (19) replied.

Their (20) dad was at (21) home when (22) he saw them. "What (23) are (24) you doing?" he asked.
"We (25) are playing," they said.
He smiled and gave them (26) a snack.
"This (27) is for (28) you. You have (29) been good," he said.

Later, they read a book about (30) animals.
Each (31) animal is (32) different. Some are (33) big, some are small.
"How (34) do animals live?" she asked.
"It (35) depends on (36) where they live," he replied.
There (37) is a bear in (38) the forest and a fish in (39) the sea.

If (40) you want to know more, read books.
Books can (41) help you learn so (42) much.
These (43) books are not (44) boring, but fun.
Other (45) kids had (46) fun with them, too.
They said (47), "Reading is fun!"

Which (48) book will you choose next?
Will (49) it be (50) about dogs or (51) cats?
By (52) reading, you learn from (53) stories.
An (54) idea grows up (55) from each page.
As (56) you grow, you learn more.

Do (57) your best, and read all (58) you can!

Evaluaci√≥n 2 Vocabulario Nivel A1

Reading Text (Students‚Äô Version): 2

One day, a girl saw some birds in her yard. She would make a picture because she like birds. She gave it to him.

She went into the house. ‚ÄúIt is time to draw,‚Äù she said. She has pencils and paper.
‚ÄúLook! I will draw two birds this time.‚Äù

She wanted to know more, so she began to write.
‚ÄúI want to go to the park to see more birds,‚Äù she said.
‚ÄúThere are a number of birds there,‚Äù Dad said.

‚ÄúBut we have no way to go now.‚Äù
‚ÄúWe could ask the people next door,‚Äù he said.

‚ÄúMy friend has a bike,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúI can go with him.‚Äù
‚ÄúIt is better than walking,‚Äù Dad said.
‚ÄúIt is the first time for this.‚Äù

She took her water bottle and bag. She had been ready all week.
‚ÄúLet‚Äôs call Amy and ask who wants to go.‚Äù

At the park, she saw a bird with oil on its wings.
‚ÄúNow I can find many birds!‚Äù she said.

They walked a long way and sat down under a tree.
They stayed all day. She did many pictures.

‚ÄúYou get better!‚Äù Dad said.
More kids come to see what she made.
‚ÄúYou may help others learn,‚Äù said a boy.

This part was the best part of her week.
There were birds flying over the trees.
The birds made a new sound.

‚ÄúLet‚Äôs take a photo!‚Äù Dad said.
‚ÄúOnly a little wind today,‚Äù she said.
‚ÄúIt was work, but it was fun.‚Äù
‚ÄúI know this place is very nice,‚Äù she said.

Reading Text (Teacher‚Äôs Version): 2

One day (1), a girl saw some (2) birds in her (3) yard. She would (4) make (5) a picture because she like (6) birds. She gave it to him (7).

She went into (8) the house. ‚ÄúIt is time (9) to draw,‚Äù she said. She has (10) pencils and paper.
‚ÄúLook (11)! I will draw two (12) birds this time.‚Äù

She wanted to know more (13), so she began to write (14).
‚ÄúI want to go (15) to the park to see (16) more birds,‚Äù she said.
‚ÄúThere are a number (17) of birds there,‚Äù Dad said.

‚ÄúBut we have no (18) way (19) to go now.‚Äù
‚ÄúWe could (20) ask the people (21) next door,‚Äù he said.

‚ÄúMy (22) friend has a bike,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúI can go with him.‚Äù
‚ÄúIt is better than (23) walking,‚Äù Dad said.

‚ÄúI know (49) this place (50) is very (51) nice,‚Äù she said.

Evaluaci√≥n 3 Vocabulario Nivel A1

Reading Text (Students‚Äô Version): 3

One day, after lunch, we went back to class.
The teacher said, ‚ÄúI have a good story for you. Look at me and listen.‚Äù

She said, ‚ÄúThis is our book. I will read just one page. The boy‚Äôs name is Tom.‚Äù
She read the sentence: ‚ÄúThe man is kind.‚Äù

I think it is fun when teachers say stories.
‚ÄúIt is a great story,‚Äù said Sam.
‚ÄúWhere did you get it?‚Äù he asked.

‚ÄúIt can help us read better,‚Äù she said.
We read through the book. It was so much fun.

We had to finish before we go home.
‚ÄúMake a line,‚Äù the teacher said.
‚ÄúGo to the right, not the left.‚Äù

‚ÄúI want to read too,‚Äù said Anna.
She asked, ‚ÄúWhat means this word?‚Äù

My dad is old, but he reads to me.
He said, ‚ÄúIf you find any hard words, ask.‚Äù

We all had the same book.
I will tell my mom about it.
The boy in the story can run fast.

I like to follow the words with my finger.
The teacher came to help me.
I want to read more books now.

We had to show the page to a friend.
‚ÄúI will also draw the boy,‚Äù said Kim.
We looked around the room. Everyone smiled.

Let‚Äôs form a team to read.
We picked three kids. I was happy.

‚ÄúI see one small cat in the book,‚Äù said Max.
The teacher said, ‚ÄúNow we will set the book on the shelf.‚Äù

We put it there and went to the door.
‚ÄúIt is the end of class,‚Äù she said.

‚ÄúDoes everyone have the paper?‚Äù
We took another one, well made.

The cat was not large, not big, but it was cute.
We must read that page again!

‚ÄúTom is nice. He can even help the cat.‚Äù
‚ÄúIt is such a sweet story,‚Äù I said.

We clapped, because we loved it.
‚ÄúNow, we will turn the lights off,‚Äù the teacher said.

‚ÄúHere is your bag,‚Äù she told me.
‚ÄúWhy do you smile so much?‚Äù she asked.

Evaluaci√≥n 4 Vocabulario Nivel A1

Reading Text (Students‚Äô Version): 4

Today, the teacher said, ‚ÄúPlease ask questions if you do not understand.‚Äù
We went to class early. The men who work at the school cleaned the floor.

We sat and read a short story.
‚ÄúYou need to listen,‚Äù the teacher said.

‚ÄúThis land has many places with different animals.‚Äù
When we go home, we tell our mom what we learned. She helps us with reading.

Next, we will move to another class.
‚ÄúI will try to do my best,‚Äù I said.

The teacher is very kind.
She gave me a high-five with her hand.
We looked at a big picture of a tree.
Then we looked at it again.

We had to change our seats.
Then the lights went off.

We wanted to play a game with words.
‚ÄúSpell this word: air,‚Äù the teacher said.
We talked about the air and how we breathe it.

The cat ran away from the door.
It is a nice animal.
In my house, I have two pets.

The teacher pointed to the board and said, ‚ÄúPoint to the word ‚Äòtree‚Äô on the page.‚Äù
We also looked at the first letter of each word.

My mother helps me learn at home.
She helps me answer the questions.

Today I found a new book.
I want to study it more.

We are still in class.
I like to learn new things.

We should be ready to go outside.
We talked about America and what makes it special.

The world is big. We want to learn more.
The sun is high in the sky today.

Every kid has a book.
We sit near each other and talk.

Let‚Äôs add color to the map.
We talked about our favorite food.

The teacher stood between two desks.
This is our own book, not shared.

We looked below the desk and found a pencil.
We talked about a country with many plants.

I like to plant seeds in the garden.
This is the last week of school.

We love our school.
My father says I must go and learn.

I want to keep my books safe and clean.

A1 Evaluaci√≥n Temas
Capacidad: ¬øQu√© va a hacer el profesor? 2

Hace las preguntas para evaluar los temas que debe conocer en ese nivel como familia, info personal; aunque reconocemos que no se ha abarcado completamente.

Evaluaci√≥n: ¬øQu√© debe poder hacer el estudiante? 2

Ser capaz de responder las preguntas con una respuesta en nivel b√°sico

Preguntas para evaluar los temas
Tema 1: 1. Personal Information & Identity

  1. What‚Äôs your name?

  2. Where are you from?

  3. How old are you?

  4. Do you have brothers or sisters?

  5. What‚Äôs your mother's name?

  6. What‚Äôs your father's job?

  7. Do you have a big family?

  8. Are you married?

  9. Do you have children?

  10. What are your children‚Äôs names?

  11. What time do you wake up?

  12. What do you usually eat for breakfast?

  13. Do you like coffee or tea?

  14. What time do you go to bed?

  15. Can you cook?

  16. What do you do on weekends?

  17. What‚Äôs your favorite food?

  18. Do you speak English?

  19. What other languages do you speak?

  20. What‚Äôs your favorite color?

  21. What do you do? (What's your job?)

  22. Where do you live?

  23. Do you live in a house or an apartment?

  24. What‚Äôs your address?

  25. What‚Äôs your phone number?

  26. What‚Äôs your email address?

  27. What‚Äôs the weather like today?

  28. What day is it today?

  29. What time is it now?

  30. What‚Äôs your favorite day of the week?

  31. What do you do in the morning?

  32. What do you do in the evening?

  33. Do you have any pets?

  34. What‚Äôs your favorite animal?

  35. What‚Äôs your favorite sport?

  36. Can you play the guitar?

  37. What music do you like?

  38. What‚Äôs your favorite movie?

  39. What do you do in your free time?

  40. What time do you start work?

  41. What time do you finish work?

  42. Do you like traveling?

  43. Have you ever been to another country?

  44. Do you like learning English?

  45. What‚Äôs your favorite English word?

  46. What clothes are you wearing now?

  47. What do you usually wear to work?

  48. What‚Äôs your best friend‚Äôs name?

  49. Where does your best friend live?

  50. Tell me about your family.

Tema 2: 2. Family

  1. Who is your mom?

  2. What‚Äôs your dad‚Äôs name?

  3. Do you have a brother?

  4. How many sisters do you have?

  5. Is your grandma alive?

  6. Where does your grandpa live?

  7. Is your baby brother funny?

  8. How old is your child?

  9. What does your mom do?

  10. Does your dad like music?

  11. Do you live with your parents?

  12. How many children do you have?

  13. Is your husband at home now?

  14. What‚Äôs your wife‚Äôs name?

  15. Do you have a son or a daughter?

  16. Do your cousins live near you?

  17. Does your uncle visit often?

  18. What does your aunt like to cook?

  19. How many siblings do you have?

  20. Does your cousin have a pet?

  21. Do you have any grandchildren?

  22. What‚Äôs your nephew‚Äôs name?

  23. Is your niece still a child?

  24. Do you like your stepmom?

  25. Where does your stepdad work?

  26. Do you have a stepson or a stepdaughter?

  27. Is your partner friendly?

  28. Are you engaged?

  29. Was your grandpa a teacher?

  30. Who is your mother-in-law?

  31. Are you a twin?

  32. Do you have any adopted siblings?

  33. Who is the tallest in your family?

  34. Is your sister older than you?

  35. Are your parents kind?

  36. Do you live in a big household?

  37. Is your mom strict or relaxed?

  38. Who is the youngest in your family?

  39. Do you know your ancestors?

  40. How many people live in your house?

  41. Do you have a stepbrother?

  42. How old is your stepsister?

  43. Do you visit your great-grandparents?

  44. Do you have a half-brother or half-sister?

  45. Is your family close or distant?

  46. Who is the oldest person in your family?

  47. Do you know your family‚Äôs lineage?

  48. Who is the matriarch in your family?

  49. Are you close to your kin?

  50. Will you visit your family next weekend?

Tema 3: 3. Daily Routines ‚è∞ü™•üçΩÔ∏è

  1. What time do you get up?

  2. Do you brush your teeth every morning?

  3. What do you do after breakfast?

  4. What time do you go to school or work?

  5. Do you take a shower in the morning or at night?

  6. What do you eat for breakfast?

  7. What time do you have lunch?

  8. Do you go to bed early or late?

  9. What do you do in the afternoon?

  10. Do you make your bed every day?

  11. What time do you finish work or school?

  12. Do you cook dinner?

  13. Do you watch TV in the evening?

  14. What time do you go to sleep?

  15. Do you use your phone before sleeping?

  16. Do you clean your room every day?

  17. What do you do on weekends?

  18. Do you drink coffee or tea in the morning?

  19. What time do you leave your house?

  20. Do you walk or take a bus to school/work?

  21. Do you study at night?

  22. What do you do before you sleep?

  23. Do you listen to music during the day?

  24. What time do you eat dinner?

  25. Do you do the same things every day?

A1 Evaluaci√≥n Listening
Capacidad: ¬øQu√© va a hacer el profesor? 3
  1. Opci√≥n 1: El profesor coloca un audio de reductores de ruido y el estudiante dice qu√© dijo el audio y lo traduce al espa√±ol. (El estudiante dice: She‚Äôs tall - Ella es alta)
  2. Opci√≥n 2: El docente lee los reductores y el estudiante dice qu√© dijo el audio y lo traduce al espa√±ol. (El estudiante dice: She‚Äôs tall - Ella es alta)
Evaluaci√≥n: ¬øQu√© debe poder hacer el estudiante? 3

Debe poder entender los siguientes audios.

Audios a evaluar
Reductor Saludos y Despedidas Choco Turbo

Reductor Saludos y Despedidas Choco Turbo

Frase

Traducci√≥n de Frase

Hi! How are you?

¬°Hola! ¬øC√≥mo est√°s?

Hello, nice to meet you!

A1 Evaluaci√≥n Comprensi√≥n
Capacidad: ¬øQu√© va a hacer el profesor? 4

Va a evaluar las estructuras que debe manejar en ese nivel como tiempos y verbos.

Evaluaci√≥n: ¬øQu√© debe poder hacer el estudiante? 4

Debe poder comprender cualquiera de las siguientes lecturas

Lecturas a Evaluar
Lectura 1 Comprensi√≥n Nivel A1

1. My Family

I have a small family. I live with my parents and my brother. My mother is a teacher, and my father is a doctor. My brother is 10 years old. He likes to play soccer. We have a dog. Its name is Max. We love Max very much.

2. My House

I live in a big house. There are three bedrooms, a kitchen, a living room, and two bathrooms. My bedroom is small, but I like it. There is a bed, a desk, and a chair in my room. I also have a window with a nice view.

3. My Best Friend

My best friend is Maria. She is 20 years old. She lives in my neighborhood. We like to study and play together. Maria is very funny and kind. She likes to draw and listen to music. I like her because she always helps me.

Lectura 2 Comprensi√≥n Nivel A1

4. My Favorite Food

I love pizza! My favorite pizza has cheese, tomatoes, and chicken. I also like pasta and rice. For dessert, I like ice cream and chocolate. On weekends, my family eats dinner at a restaurant. We always enjoy the food!

5. A Day at School

I go to school from Monday to Friday. My classes start at 8:00 a.m. and finish at 3:00 p.m. My favorite subject is English. I also like math, but it is a little difficult. At school, I talk with my friends and play in the park during lunch.

6. My Hobbies

I have many hobbies. I like to play basketball and swim. I also like to read books and watch movies. On Saturdays, I go to the park to ride my bike. I enjoy drawing pictures, too. Hobbies make me happy.

7. The Weather

Today, the weather is sunny and warm. I like sunny days because I can go outside. In the summer, it is very hot, but I enjoy swimming. In the winter, it is cold and sometimes snowy. I wear a coat, scarf, and gloves in winter.

Lectura 3 Comprensi√≥n Nivel A1

Dayana: I need your help, can you help me please?
Richard: Sure, tell me what you need

Dayana: What time is it?
Richard: It's 8 o'clock

Dayana: What's your phone number?
Richard: It's 3103534870

Dayana: What's your email address?
Richard: It's chocoenglish@gmail.com

Dayana: How do you say ‚Äúarroz‚Äù?
Richard: Rice

Dayana: Are you married?
Richard: Yes, I'm married

Lectura 4 Comprensi√≥n Nivel A1

Dayana: How was your day?
Richard: It was great, I really enjoyed it

Dayana: How was your weekend?
Richard: It was really bad, I couldn't do much

Dayana: Who‚Äôs your best friend?
Richard: My best friend is my cousin, Marta

Dayana: Do you have siblings?
Richard: Yeah, I have siblings

Dayana: How many siblings do you have?
Richard: Yeah, I have 6 siblings: 1 sister and 5 brothers

Dayana: Do you have children?
Richard: Yeah, I have children

Dayana: How many children do you have?
Richard: I've got 4 kids: 1 boy and 3 girls

Dayana: Do you have friends?
Richard: Yeah, I've got friends

Dayana: How many friends do you have?
Richard: Wow, I've got a lot of friends

1. My Family

I have a small family. I live with my parents and my brother. My mother is a teacher, and my father is a doctor. My brother is 10 years old. He likes to play soccer. We have a dog. Its name is Max. We love Max very much.

2. My House

I live in a big house. There are three bedrooms, a kitchen, a living room, and two bathrooms. My bedroom is small, but I like it. There is a bed, a desk, and a chair in my room. I also have a window with a nice view.

3. My Best Friend

My best friend is Maria. She is 20 years old. She lives in my neighborhood. We like to study and play together. Maria is very funny and kind. She likes to draw and listen to music. I like her because she always helps me.

Lectura 2 Comprensi√≥n Nivel A1

I love pizza! My favorite pizza has cheese, tomatoes, and chicken. I also like pasta and rice. For dessert, I like ice cream and chocolate. On weekends, my family eats dinner at a restaurant. We always enjoy the food!

5. A Day at School

I go to school from Monday to Friday. My classes start at 8:00 a.m. and finish at 3:00 p.m. My favorite subject is English. I also like math, but it is a little difficult. At school, I talk with my friends and play in the park during lunch.

6. My Hobbies

I have many hobbies. I like to play basketball and swim. I also like to read books and watch movies. On Saturdays, I go to the park to ride my bike. I enjoy drawing pictures, too. Hobbies make me happy.

7. The Weather

Today, the weather is sunny and warm. I like sunny days because I can go outside. In the summer, it is very hot, but I enjoy swimming. In the winter, it is cold and sometimes snowy. I wear a coat, scarf, and gloves in winter.

A1 Evaluaci√≥n Speaking
Capacidad: ¬øQu√© va a hacer el profesor? 5

Hace las preguntas para evaluar su capacidad de comunicarse y hablar en ingl√©s

Evaluaci√≥n: ¬øQu√© debe poder hacer el estudiante? 5

Ser capaz de responder las preguntas con una respuesta en nivel b√°sico

Preguntas para evaluar el speaking
  1. How are you?
  2. What's your name?
  3. Where are you from?
  4. How old are you?
  5. When‚Äôs your birthday?
  6. Where do you live?
  7. What do you do?
  8. Where do you work/study?
  9. What's your favorite [book/movie/food/hobby/color]?
  10. What time is it?
  11. I need your help, can you help me please?
  12. What do you think about money/politics‚Ä¶?
  13. What will you do tomorrow?
  14. Do you have any plans for the weekend?
  15. Do you like to eat/play/sleep?
  16. What do you do in your free time?
  17. What's your phone number/email address?
  18. How was your day/weekend?
  19. Who‚Äôs your best friend?
  20. Do you have siblings/children/friends? How many?
  21. How do you say ‚Äúarroz‚Äù?
  22. Are you married/single/engaged?
  23. I would like to know a little bit about you
  24. What would you do if‚Ä¶
  25. Would you like a sandwich?
  26. Would you like some water?
  27. Would you like to go to the park?
  28. Would you like to meet my friend?
  29. Would you like to watch a movie?
  30. Is it cold?
  31. Is it sunny today?
  32. What‚Äôs the weather like?
  33. Is it raining now?
  34. Can I have a coffee, please?
  35. What do you have the menu?
  36. Do you like pizza?
  37. Can you say "sorry"?
  38. How do you say "thank you"?
  39. Can you repeat, please?
  40. Can you open the door?
  41. Where is the bathroom?
  42. How do I go to the park?
A1 Evaluaci√≥n Herramientas
Capacidad: ¬øQu√© va a hacer el profesor? 6
  • Asegurarse de que todos los estudiantes tienen las actividades de este nivel realizadas para poder ser aprobados en esta evaluaci√≥n.
  • El profesor hace una evaluaci√≥n del ANKI de cada estudiante tal y como se hace en las clases en vivo regulares; la diferencia radica en que el profesor eval√∫a (sin previo aviso) diferentes contenidos al mismo estudiante en la misma clase
Actividades a realizar
  1. Audios Diarios: 60 publicaciones subidas
  2. Actividades de la plataforma: 25 publicaciones subidas
  3. Tests: 9 tests aprobados subidas
Evaluaci√≥n: ¬øQu√© debe poder hacer el estudiante? 6
  • Plataforma y herramientas: Conocer todo el contenido del ANKI.
  • Herramienta de reducci√≥n de ruido: Que pueda entender cualquier audio de reducci√≥n de ruido
Reducci√≥n de Ruido a Evaluar (Las mismas del nivel)

No llegues tarde.

No abras la puerta.

No grites.

No lo olvides.
